Stench.description: By releasing a stench when attacking, this Pokémon has a 10% chance to cause the target to flinch. This does not stack with moves or items that have a chance to flinch.

Drizzle.description: The Pokémon makes it rain when it enters a battle.

Speed Boost.description: The Pokémon’s Speed stat is boosted every turn.

Battle Armor.description: Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

Sturdy.description: The Pokémon cannot be knocked out by a single hit as long as its HP is full. One-hit KO moves will also fail to knock it out.

Damp.description: The Pokémon dampens its surroundings, preventing all Pokémon from using explosive moves such as Self-Destruct or dealing damage with Aftermath.

Limber.description: The Pokémon’s limber body prevents it from being paralyzed.

Sand Veil.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in a sandstorm by 20%. The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms.

Static.description: The Pokémon is charged with static electricity and has a 30% chance to paralyze attackers that make direct contact with it.

Volt Absorb.description: If hit by an Electric-type move, the Pokémon has ¼ of its maximum HP restored instead of taking damage.

Water Absorb.description: If hit by a Water-type move, the Pokémon has ¼ of its maximum HP restored instead of taking damage.

Oblivious.description: The Pokémon is oblivious, keeping it from being infatuated, falling for taunts, or being affected by Intimidate.

Compound Eyes.description: The Pokémon’s compound eyes boost its accuracy by 30%.

Insomnia.description: The Pokémon’s insomnia prevents it from falling asleep.

Color Change.description: The Pokémon’s type becomes the type of the move used on it.

Immunity.description: The Pokémon’s immune system prevents it from being poisoned.

Flash Fire.description: If hit by a Fire-type move, the Pokémon absorbs the flames and uses them to power up its own Fire-type moves by 50%.

Shield Dust.description: Protective dust shields the Pokémon from the additional effects of moves.

Own Tempo.description: The Pokémon sticks to its own tempo, preventing it from becoming confused or being affected by Intimidate.

Suction Cups.description: The Pokémon uses suction cups to stay in one spot. This protects it from moves and items that would force it to switch out.

Intimidate.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it intimidates opposing Pokémon and makes them cower, lowering their Attack stats.

Shadow Tag.description: The Pokémon steps on the opposing Pokémon’s shadows to prevent them from fleeing or switching out.

Rough Skin.description: The Pokémon’s rough skin damages attackers that make direct contact with it, damaging the attacker for ⅛ of their maximum HP.

Wonder Guard.description: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokémon.

Levitate.description: By floating in the air, the Pokémon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves.

Effect Spore.description: Contact with the Pokémon has a 30% chance to inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on the attacker.

Synchronize.description: Passes its status condition to the Pokémon that inflicted it. If this Pokémon is your lead into battle, opposing wild Pokémon will share its nature.

Clear Body.description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats.

Natural Cure.description: The Pokémon’s status conditions are cured when it switches out.

Lightning Rod.description: The Pokémon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.

Serene Grace.description: Doubles the likelihood of additional effects occurring when the Pokémon uses its moves. This does not affect items.

Swift Swim.description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat in rain.

Chlorophyll.description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat in harsh sunlight.

Illuminate.description: By illuminating its surroundings, the Pokémon prevents its accuracy from being lowered. If this Pokémon is your lead into battle, it raises the likelihood of double battles.

Trace.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon copies an opposing Pokémon’s Ability.

Poison Point.description: Contact with the Pokémon has a 30% chance to poison the attacker.

Inner Focus.description: The Pokémon’s intense focus prevents it from flinching or being affected by Intimidate.

Magma Armor.description: The Pokémon’s hot magma coating prevents it from being frozen.

Water Veil.description: The Pokémon’s water veil prevents it from being burned.

Magnet Pull.description: Prevents Steel-type Pokémon from fleeing by pulling them in with magnetism.

Soundproof.description: Soundproofing gives the Pokémon full immunity to all sound-based moves.

Rain Dish.description: The Pokémon gradually regains ¹⁄₁₆ of their maximum HP at the end of each turn in rain.

Sand Stream.description: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

Pressure.description: Puts opposing Pokémon under pressure, causing them to expend one more PP than usual when using their moves.

Thick Fat.description: The Pokémon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves.

Early Bird.description: The Pokémon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokémon.

Flame Body.description: Contact with the Pokémon has a 30% chance to burn the attacker.

Run Away.description: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

Keen Eye.description: The Pokémon’s keen eyes prevent its accuracy from being lowered. It also ignores boosts to the target’s evasion.

Hyper Cutter.description: The Pokémon’s prized, mighty pincers prevent other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.

Pickup.description: The Pokémon may pick up an item another Pokémon used during a battle, even if it did not participate.

Truant.description: Each time the Pokémon uses a move, it spends the next turn loafing around.

Hustle.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat by 50%, but lowers the accuracy of its physical moves by 20%.

Cute Charm.description: The Pokémon has a 30% chance to infatuate attackers that make direct contact with it.

Plus.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon by 50% if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

Minus.description: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon by 50% if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle.

Forecast.description: The Pokémon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice.

Sticky Hold.description: The Pokémon’s held items cling to its sticky body and cannot be removed by other Pokémon.

Shed Skin.description: The Pokémon has a 33% chance to cure its own status conditions at the end of each turn by shedding its skin.

Guts.description: It’s so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat by 50%. If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack.

Marvel Scale.description: The Pokémon’s marvelous scales boost its Defense stat by 50% if it has a status condition.

Liquid Ooze.description: The strong stench of the Pokémon’s oozed liquid damages attackers that use HP-draining moves instead of healing them.

Overgrow.description: Powers up Grass-type moves by 50% when the Pokémon’s HP drops to ⅓ or less.

Blaze.description: Powers up Fire-type moves by 50% when the Pokémon’s HP drops to ⅓ or less.

Torrent.description: Powers up Water-type moves by 50% when the Pokémon’s HP drops to ⅓ or less.

Swarm.description: Powers up Bug-type moves by 50% when the Pokémon’s HP drops to ⅓ or less.

Rock Head.description: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

Drought.description: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Arena Trap.description: Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing from battle. If this Pokémon is your lead into battle, it raises the likelihood of double battles.

Vital Spirit.description: The Pokémon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep.

White Smoke.description: The Pokémon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

Pure Power.description: Using its pure power, the Pokémon doubles its Attack stat.

Shell Armor.description: A hard shell protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

Tangled Feet.description: Moves targeting the Pokémon have their accuracy halved while the Pokémon is confused.

Motor Drive.description: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Electric-type moves. Instead, its Speed stat is boosted.

Rivalry.description: The Pokémon’s competitive spirit makes it deal 25% increased damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but 25% reduced damage to Pokémon of the opposite gender.

Steadfast.description: The Pokémon’s determination boosts its Speed stat every time it flinches.

Snow Cloak.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s evasiveness in snow or a hailstorm by 20%. The Pokémon takes no damage from hail.

Gluttony.description: If the Pokémon is holding a Berry to be eaten when its HP is ¼ or less, such as a Starf Berry, it will instead eat that Berry when its HP drops to half or less.

Anger Point.description: The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.

Unburden.description: Doubles the Speed stat of the Pokémon if its held item is used or lost.

Heatproof.description: The Pokémon’s heatproof body halves the damage taken from Fire-type moves and being burned.

Simple.description: Doubles the effects of the Pokémon’s stat changes.

Dry Skin.description: Restores ¼ of the Pokémon’s maximum HP when hit by Water-type moves or ⅛ of the Pokémon’s maximum HP at the end of each turn in rain. However, the Pokémon receives 25% increased damage from Fire-type moves and loses ⅛ of its maximum HP at the end of each turn in harsh sunlight.

Download.description: The Pokémon compares an opposing Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat — whichever will be more effective.

Poison Heal.description: If poisoned, the Pokémon has ⅛ of its maximum HP restored instead of taking damage.

Adaptability.description: Increases the boost moves of the same type as the Pokémon get from 1.5x to 2x. Does not stack with the Stellar-type Tera boost.

Skill Link.description: Maximizes the number of times multistrike moves hit.

Hydration.description: Cures the Pokémon’s status conditions at the end of each turn in rain.

Solar Power.description: The Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat is boosted by 50% in harsh sunlight, but it loses ⅛ of its maximum HP at the end of each turn.

Quick Feet.description: Boosts the Speed stat by 50% if the Pokémon has a status condition.

Normalize.description: All the Pokémon’s moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted by 20%.

Sniper.description: If the Pokémon’s attack lands a critical hit, the attack is powered up by an additional 1.5x, making for 2.25x the normal damage.

Magic Guard.description: The Pokémon only takes damage from direct attacks.

No Guard.description: The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land. If this Pokémon is your lead into battle, it raises the likelihood of double battles.

Stall.description: The Pokémon is always the last to use its moves.

Technician.description: Powers up moves which have a base power of 60 or less by 50%.

Leaf Guard.description: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight.

Klutz.description: The Pokémon can’t use any held items.

Mold Breaker.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

Super Luck.description: The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted by one stage.

Aftermath.description: Damages the attacker by ¼ of their maximum HP if the Pokémon is knocked out with a move that makes direct contact.

Anticipation.description: The Pokémon can sense an opposing Pokémon’s dangerous moves.

Forewarn.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokémon has.

Unaware.description: The Pokémon ignores the opposing Pokémon’s stat changes when attacking or defending.

Tinted Lens.description: The Pokémon’s "not very effective" attacks deal double damage.

Filter.description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks that hit the Pokémon by 25%.

Slow Start.description: For five turns, the Pokémon’s Attack and Speed stats are halved.

Scrappy.description: The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves. It is also unaffected by Intimidate.

Storm Drain.description: The Pokémon draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of taking damage from them, its Sp. Atk stat is boosted.

Ice Body.description: The Pokémon gradually regains ¹⁄₁₆ of their maximum HP at the end of each turn in snow or a hailstorm. The Pokémon takes no damage from hail.

Solid Rock.description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks that hit the Pokémon by 25%.

Snow Warning.description: The Pokémon makes it snow when it enters a battle.

Honey Gather.description: The Pokémon gathers Honey which is then sold for money after a battle is won, even if it did not participate.

Frisk.description: When it enters a battle, the Pokémon can check an opposing Pokémon’s Ability.

Reckless.description: Powers up moves that have recoil damage by 20%.

Multitype.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the Plate it holds.

Flower Gift.description: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and its allies next to it in battle by 50% in harsh sunlight.

Bad Dreams.description: Damages opposing Pokémon that are asleep at the end of each turn by ⅛ of their maximum HP.

Pickpocket.description: The Pokémon steals a held item from attackers that make direct contact with it.

Sheer Force.description: Removes any additional effects from the Pokémon’s moves, but increases the moves’ power by 30%.

Contrary.description: Reverses any stat changes affecting the Pokémon so that attempts to boost its stats instead lower them — and attempts to lower its stats will boost them.

Unnerve.description: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

Defiant.description: If the Pokémon has any stat lowered by an opposing Pokémon, its Attack stat will be boosted sharply.

Defeatist.description: Halves the Pokémon’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP drops to half or less.

Cursed Body.description: The Pokémon has a 30% chance to disable a move that has inflicted damage on it.

Healer.description: Allies next to the Pokémon in battle have a 30% chance to be cured of their status conditions at the end of each turn.

Friend Guard.description: Allies next to the Pokémon in battle receive 25% reduced damage.

Weak Armor.description: The Pokémon’s Defense stat is lowered when it takes damage from physical moves, but its Speed stat is sharply boosted.

Multiscale.description: Halves the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

Toxic Boost.description: Powers up physical moves by 50% when the Pokémon is poisoned.

Flare Boost.description: Powers up special moves by 50% when the Pokémon is burned.

Harvest.description: The Pokémon has a 50% chance to create another Berry after one is used. This is increased to 100% in harsh sunlight.

Telepathy.description: The Pokémon anticipates and dodges the attacks of its allies next to it in battle.

Moody.description: Every turn, one of the Pokémon’s stats will be boosted sharply, but another stat will be lowered. Accuracy and evasion are excluded.

Overcoat.description: The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms or hail. It is also protected from the effects of powders and spores.

Poison Touch.description: The Pokémon has a 30% chance to poison a target when using a move that makes contact.

Regenerator.description: The Pokémon has ⅓ of its maximum HP restored when withdrawn from battle.

Big Pecks.description: Prevents the Pokémon from having its Defense stat lowered.

Sand Rush.description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a sandstorm. The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms.

Wonder Skin.description: Lowers the accuracy of status moves used against the Pokémon to 50%.

Analytic.description: Boosts the power of the Pokémon’s move by 30% if it is the last to act that turn.

Illusion.description: The Pokémon fools opponents by entering battle disguised as the last Pokémon in its Trainer’s party.

Imposter.description: The Pokémon transforms itself into the Pokémon it’s facing, copying everything about it except their HP and level. Copied moves only have 5 PP each.

Infiltrator.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unaffected by the target’s barriers, substitutes, and the like.

Mummy.description: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker’s Ability to Mummy.

Moxie.description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it shows moxie, which boosts its Attack stat.

Justified.description: When the Pokémon is hit by a Dark-type attack, its Attack stat is boosted by its sense of justice.

Rattled.description: The Pokémon gets scared when hit by a Dark-, Ghost-, or Bug-type attack or if intimidated, which boosts its Speed stat.

Magic Bounce.description: The Pokémon reflects status moves instead of getting hit by them.

Sap Sipper.description: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Grass-type moves. Instead, its Attack stat is boosted.

Prankster.description: Gives priority to the Pokémon’s status moves. Dark-type Pokémon are immune to these moves.

Sand Force.description: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm by 30%. The Pokémon takes no damage from sandstorms.

Iron Barbs.description: The Pokémon’s iron barbs damages attackers that make direct contact with it, damaging the attacker for ⅛ of their maximum HP.

Zen Mode.description: The Pokémon changes its form to Zen Mode when its HP drops to half or less.

Victory Star.description: The Pokémon and its allies next to it in battle have their accuracy boosted by 10%.

Turboblaze.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

Teravolt.description: The Pokémon’s moves are unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

Aroma Veil.description: Protects the Pokémon and its allies next to it in battle from effects that prevent the use of moves.

Flower Veil.description: If the Pokémon or its allies next to it in battle are Grass-type, they are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats.

Cheek Pouch.description: The Pokémon’s HP is restored by ⅓ of its maximum HP when it eats any Berry, in addition to the Berry’s usual effect.

Protean.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use.

Magician.description: The Pokémon steals the held item from any target it hits with a move.

Bulletproof.description: Protects the Pokémon from ball and bomb moves.

Competitive.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat sharply when its stats are lowered by an opposing Pokémon.

Strong Jaw.description: The Pokémon’s strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves by 50%.

Refrigerate.description: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted by 20%.

Sweet Veil.description: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies next to it in battle from falling asleep.

Stance Change.description: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King’s Shield.

Gale Wings.description: Gives priority to the Pokémon’s Flying-type moves while its HP is full.

Mega Launcher.description: Boosts the power of aura and pulse moves by 50%.

Grass Pelt.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat by 50% on Grassy Terrain.

Symbiosis.description: The Pokémon passes an item to allies that have used their items next to it in battle.

Tough Claws.description: Powers up moves that make direct contact by 30%.

Pixilate.description: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted by 20%.

Gooey.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

Aerilate.description: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted by 20%.

Parental Bond.description: The Pokémon strikes twice, with the second strike dealing 25% of its usual damage. Multistrike moves and moves that target multiple Pokémon are ignored.

Dark Aura.description: Powers up the Dark-type moves of all Pokémon on the field by 33%.

Fairy Aura.description: Powers up the Fairy-type moves of all Pokémon on the field by 33%.

Aura Break.description: The effects of Fairy Aura and Dark Aura are reversed and nullified, causing affected moves to be 25% weaker.

Primordial Sea.description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Fire-type attacks.

Desolate Land.description: The Pokémon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks.

Delta Stream.description: The Pokémon changes the weather so that no moves are supereffective against the Flying type.

Stamina.description: Boosts the Defense stat when the Pokémon is hit by an attack.

Wimp Out.description: The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP drops to half or less.

Emergency Exit.description: The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP drops to half or less.

Water Compaction.description: Boosts the Defense stat sharply when the Pokémon is hit by a Water-type move.

Merciless.description: The Pokémon’s attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.

Shields Down.description: When its HP drops to half or less, the Pokémon’s shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.

Stakeout.description: Doubles the damage dealt to a target that has just switched into battle.

Water Bubble.description: Halves the power of Fire-type moves that hit the Pokémon and prevent it from being burned. Also doubles the power of the Pokémon’s Water-type moves.

Berserk.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to drop to half or less.

Slush Rush.description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat in snow or a hailstorm. The Pokémon takes no damage from hail.

Long Reach.description: The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.

Triage.description: Gives priority to the Pokémon’s healing moves.

Galvanize.description: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted by 20%.

Surge Surfer.description: Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat while on Electric Terrain.

Schooling.description: The Pokémon forms a powerful school when it reaches level 20. It stops schooling when its HP drops to ¼ or less.

Disguise.description: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokémon can protect it from an attack at the cost of losing ⅛ of its maximum HP.

Battle Bond.description: Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the Pokémon’s bond with its Trainer and causes it to transform. After transforming, Water Shuriken will always land three hits with a boosted 20 power per hit.

Power Construct.description: Cells gather to aid the Pokémon when its HP drops to half or less, causing it to change into its Complete Forme.

Corrosion.description: The Pokémon can poison the target even if it’s a Steel- or Poison-type.

Comatose.description: The Pokémon is always drowsing and can attack while in its sleeping state. It is considered under the effects of a status condition.

Queenly Majesty.description: The Pokémon’s majesty pressures opponents and makes them unable to use priority moves against the Pokémon or its allies next to it in battle.

Innards Out.description: When the Pokémon is knocked out, it damages its attacker by the amount equal to the HP it had left before it was hit.

Dancer.description: Whenever a dance move is used in battle, the Pokémon will copy the user to immediately perform that dance move itself.

Battery.description: Allies next to the Pokémon in battle have their Sp. Atk increased by 30% when using special moves.

Fluffy.description: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves.

Dazzling.description: The Pokémon dazzles its opponents, making them unable to use priority moves against the Pokémon or its allies next to it in battle.

Soul-Heart.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat every time another Pokémon faints.

Tangling Hair.description: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s Speed stat.

Receiver.description: If the Pokémon’s ally was defeated in battle while the Pokémon is present, the Pokémon receives the Ability of that ally.

Power of Alchemy.description: If the Pokémon’s ally was defeated in battle while the Pokémon is present, the Pokémon copies the Ability of that ally.

Beast Boost.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat every time it knocks out a target.

RKS System.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the memory disc it holds.

Electric Surge.description: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Psychic Surge.description: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Misty Surge.description: Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Grassy Surge.description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Full Metal Body.description: Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon’s stats. This effect cannot be ignored by other moves or Abilities.

Shadow Shield.description: Halves the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full. This effect cannot be ignored by other moves or Abilities.

Prism Armor.description: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken by 25%. This effect cannot be ignored by other moves or Abilities.

Neuroforce.description: Powers up moves that are super effective by 25%.

Intrepid Sword.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Dauntless Shield.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat when the Pokémon enters a battle.

Libero.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use.

Ball Fetch.description: The Pokémon will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle, even if it did not participate.

Cotton Down.description: When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokémon except itself.

Propeller Tail.description: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s Abilities and moves that draw in moves.

Mirror Armor.description: Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.

Gulp Missile.description: After using Surf or Dive, the Pokémon catches prey in its mouth. Taking damage causes the Pokémon to spit prey at its attacker, dealing ¼ of the attacker’s maximum HP in damage in addition to either lowering their Defense or inflicting paralysis, depending on the prey that was caught.

Stalwart.description: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s Abilities and moves that draw in moves.

Steam Engine.description: Boosts the Speed stat by six stages when the Pokémon is hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.

Punk Rock.description: Boosts the power of sound-based moves by 30%. The Pokémon also takes half the damage from these kinds of moves.

Sand Spit.description: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it’s hit by an attack.

Ice Scales.description: The Pokémon is protected by ice scales, which halve the damage taken from special moves.

Ripen.description: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

Ice Face.description: The Pokémon’s ice head can take a physical attack as a substitute, but the attack also changes the Pokémon’s appearance. The ice will be restored when it begins to snow or hail.

Power Spot.description: Allies next to the Pokémon in battle deal 30% increased damage.

Mimicry.description: Changes the Pokémon’s type depending on the terrain.

Screen Cleaner.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokémon.

Steely Spirit.description: Powers up the Steel-type moves of the Pokémon and its allies next to it in battle by 50%.

Perish Body.description: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.

Wandering Spirit.description: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

Gorilla Tactics.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat by 50%, but only allows the use of the first selected move.

Neutralizing Gas.description: While the Pokémon is in the battle, the effects of all other Pokémon’s Abilities will be nullified or will not be triggered.

Pastel Veil.description: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies next to it in battle from being poisoned.

Hunger Switch.description: The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn. This also changes Aura Wheel to be either an Electric- or Dark-type move.

Quick Draw.description: The Pokémon has a 30% chance to move first in its priority bracket.

Unseen Fist.description: If the Pokémon uses moves that make direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target protects itself.

Curious Medicine.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it scatters medicine from its shell, which removes all stat changes from allies.

Chilling Neigh.description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat.

Grim Neigh.description: When the Pokémon knocks out a target, it utters a terrifying neigh, which boosts its Sp. Atk stat.

As One.description: This Ability combines the effects of both Unnerve and Grim Neigh, preventing opposing Pokémon from consuming berries and boosting the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat when knocking out a target.

Lingering Aroma.description: Contact with the Pokémon changes the attacker’s Ability to Lingering Aroma.

Seed Sower.description: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon is hit by an attack.

Thermal Exchange.description: Boosts the Attack stat when the Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.

Anger Shell.description: When an attack causes its HP to drop to half or less, the Pokémon gets angry. This lowers its Defense and Sp. Def stats but boosts its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.

Purifying Salt.description: The Pokémon’s pure salt protects it from status conditions and halves the damage taken from Ghost-type moves.

Well-Baked Body.description: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Fire-type moves. Instead, its Defense stat is sharply boosted.

Wind Rider.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat if Tailwind takes effect or if the Pokémon is hit by a wind move. The Pokémon also takes no damage from wind moves.

Guard Dog.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat if intimidated. Moves and items that would force the Pokémon to switch out also fail to work.

Wind Power.description: The Pokémon becomes charged when Tailwind takes effect or it is hit by a wind move, boosting the power of the next Electric-type move the Pokémon uses.

Zero to Hero.description: The Pokémon transforms into its Hero Form when it switches out.

Commander.description: Upon entering battle, the Pokémon goes inside an ally Dondozo if one is on the field and raises all its stats sharply. If this Pokémon is your lead into battle, it raises the likelihood of double battles.

Electromorphosis.description: The Pokémon becomes charged when it takes damage, boosting the power of the next Electric-type move the Pokémon uses.

Protosynthesis.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat in harsh sunlight by 30%, or 50% if the stat boosted is Speed.

Quark Drive.description: Boosts the Pokémon’s most proficient stat on Electric Terrain by 30%, or 50% if the stat boosted is Speed.

Good as Gold.description: A body of pure, solid gold gives the Pokémon full immunity to other Pokémon’s status moves.

Vessel of Ruin.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous vessel lowers the Sp. Atk stats of all Pokémon except itself by 25% while on the field.

Sword of Ruin.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous sword lowers the Defense stats of all Pokémon except itself by 25% while on the field.

Tablets of Ruin.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous wooden tablets lowers the Attack stats of all Pokémon except itself by 25% while on the field.

Beads of Ruin.description: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous beads lowers the Sp. Def stats of all Pokémon except itself by 25% while on the field.

Orichalcum Pulse.description: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokémon enters a battle. The ancient pulse thrumming through the Pokémon also boosts its Attack stat by 33% in harsh sunlight.

Hadron Engine.description: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokémon enters a battle. The futuristic engine within the Pokémon also boosts its Sp. Atk stat by 33% on Electric Terrain.

Opportunist.description: If an opponent’s stat is boosted, the Pokémon seizes the opportunity to boost the same stat for itself.

Cud Chew.description: When the Pokémon eats a Berry, it will regurgitate that Berry at the end of the next turn and eat it one more time.

Supreme Overlord.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, its Attack and Sp. Atk stats receive a 10% boost for each of its allies that have already been defeated.

Costar.description: When the Pokémon enters a double battle, it copies its ally’s stat changes.

Toxic Debris.description: Scatters poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team when the Pokémon takes damage from physical moves.

Armor Tail.description: The mysterious tail covering the Pokémon’s head makes opponents unable to use priority moves against the Pokémon or its allies next to it in battle.

Earth Eater.description: If hit by a Ground-type move, the Pokémon has ¼ of its maximum HP restored instead of taking damage.

Mycelium Might.description: The Pokémon will always move last within its priority bracket when using status moves, but these moves will be unimpeded by the Ability of the target.

Mind’s Eye.description: The Pokémon ignores changes to opponents’ evasiveness, its accuracy can’t be lowered, and it can hit Ghost types with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.

Supersweet Syrup.description: A sickly sweet scent spreads across the field when the Pokémon enters a battle, lowering the evasiveness of opposing Pokémon.

Hospitality.description: When the Pokémon enters a double battle, it showers its ally with hospitality, restoring ¼ of the ally’s maximum HP.

Toxic Chain.description: The power of the Pokémon’s toxic chain has a 30% chance to badly poison any target the Pokémon hits with a move.

Embody Aspect.description: The Pokémon’s heart fills with memories, causing the Cornerstone Mask to shine and the Pokémon’s Defense stat to be boosted.

Tera Shift.description: When the Pokémon enters a battle, it absorbs the energy around itself and transforms into its Terastal Form.

Tera Shell.description: The Pokémon’s shell contains the powers of each type. All damage-dealing moves that hit the Pokémon when its HP is full will not be very effective.

Teraform Zero.description: The Pokémon uses its hidden powers to eliminate all effects of weather and terrain, reducing them to zero.

Poison Puppeteer.description: Pokémon poisoned by this Pokémon’s moves will also become confused.
